articles.author: Tim Hepher, Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: Middle East carriers look set to order tens of billions of dollars of long-haul jets at the opening of the Dubai Airshow on Monday, as Emirates renews confidence in the delayed Boeing 777X while facing new competition from rivals like Turkish Airlines.
articles.title: Looming Emirates 777X deal to kickstart Dubai Airshow, sources say

articles.author: Paritosh Bansal
articles.description: The cyber hack of Industrial and Commercial Bank of China's U.S. broker-dealer was so extensive on Wednesday, even the corporate email stopped working and forced employees to switch to Google mail, according to two people familiar with the situation.
articles.title: Inside Wall Street's scramble after ICBC hack

articles.author: Maggie Fick
articles.description: Novo Nordisk (NOVOb.CO) shares rose 3% on Monday as the market reacted to data the drugmaker presented over the weekend showing that the heart protective benefits of its popular obesity drug Wegovy are not solely due to weight loss.
articles.title: Novo Nordisk shares rise as Wegovy shows heart benefits beyond weight loss

articles.author: Tom Polansek
articles.description: Washington's decision to accept beef from Paraguay after 25 years will probably not change the overall volume of U.S. imports, even at a time of tight supplies and high prices, due to a quota on shipments, U.S. meat importers said.
articles.title: Paraguay's beef likely won't boost tight US supplies, importers say

articles.author: Valentine Hilaire, Divya Rajagopal
articles.description: Panama's top court is likely to rule against Canadian miner First Quantum when it decides on the fate of a key copper mine contract in the coming weeks, a majority of lawyers in a Reuters survey said, citing precedent for a similar verdict.
articles.title: Panama court likely to revoke First Quantum copper mine contract

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Euro zone economic growth will remain weak in the near term as services and the labour market weaken but nations in the bloc should not free discretionary bank buffers to ease the pain, European Central Bank Vice President Luis de Guindos said.
articles.title: Euro zone should not ease bank buffers, ECB says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese chipmaker Yangtze Memory Technologies Co (YMTC) has filed a lawsuit against U.S. rival Micron Technology (MU.O) alleging infringement of eight of its patents.
articles.title: Chinese chipmaker YMTC sues Micron alleging patent infringement

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Dan Williams
articles.description: The largest hospital in Gaza has ceased to function and fatalities among patients are rising, the head of the World Health Organization (WHO) said on Sunday, as a blistering Israeli assault continues in the Hamas-controlled strip.
articles.title: Gaza's largest hospital 'not functioning' amid Israeli assault

articles.author: Elizabeth Piper
articles.description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak brought back former leader David Cameron as foreign minister on Monday in a reshuffle triggered by his firing of interior minister Suella Braverman after her criticism of the police threatened his authority.
articles.title: UK's Sunak brings back Cameron, sacks interior minister in latest reset

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden wants to re-establish military-to-military ties with China, White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan said on Sunday, days before the president and the Chinese leader are set to meet.
articles.title: Biden will push China to resume military ties with US, official says
